bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to George A. Kellogg, December 1, 1941

div1.p: Hutchison thanks Kellogg for a framed picture. The picture will be given to the East Washington School where the children have depicted scenes of Lazear's life in their drama class.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to George A. Kellogg, December 1, 1941
div1.p:
This is most generous and gracious of you
to give us another framed picture for the East
Washington School. This school has made a point of
interesting the young people in the career of
Doctor Lazear. They have depicted scenes of his life
in their dramatics, and as I have written you, they
already have pictures which I have given them of
Doctor Lazear as a boy and as a man. This picture
will be much more vivid and valuable for young
people of that age and we will take particular pleasure
in presenting it to them.

We will be glad also to have the other
prints as there will be similar uses for the same in
this community and in connection with this college.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, (signed) Ralph Cooper Hutchison Mr. George A. Kellogg
257 Cornelison Avenue
Jersey City, New Jersey
